is more this simply means that you don't need to have a million indicators if you remember from the first video I do have several indicators but a lot of them are versions of the same thing and the other thing is they look at very specific things I don't have a lot of duplicates of the same thing it doesn't help me so Simplicity is the ultimate form of sophistication it's a great quote and it's something to integrate into your technical analysis there is no magic this simply means there is no technical indicator that leads to success by itself massive point to get out up front simply because so many people waste so much time looking for this it doesn't exist I'll tell you right now I've spent thousands of hours studying technical analysis indicators and fundamental analysis indicators there's nothing out there so find the things that align with what you're trying to do track them closely which is the third point to evaluate what works what doesn't work and what has the most efficacy for what you're doing next three things when I'm using technical analysis I'm not using it as predictive inputs I'm literally using it to help me understand probabilistic outcomes using that previous example we were just looking at with the Vic it is more probable for the vix to rise above my entry point than to rise below my stop loss I can visualize that probabilistically not only using just the

using it to help me understand probabilistic outcomes using that previous example we were just looking at with the Vic it is more probable for the vix to rise above my entry point than to rise below my stop loss I can visualize that probabilistically not only using just the technical analysis I've done based on recent price transactions but I can also use options and the implied volatility to help me to understand ranges the other thing product quirks I kind of talked to you about that but understanding that different rules apply in different times so again volatility products behave very differently than everything else things around a catalyst so things around earnings things around different approvals if you're in biotech things where there's Giant news that comes out that's an injection of brand new information like a CEO was committing fraud for a decade all of those things will have huge impacts on whatever you're using and it's going to violate whatever typical technical analysis you would attempt to apply and that leads into exactly this idea of catalyst and then the last grouping right here is guard rails and scaling so I use technical analysis again to set my pl targets and then also to help me understand when should I be scaling into or out of different products either for profits or losses the other two things I want to talk about is pl validation and waiting pl validation is essentially when we look at

to set my pl targets and then also to help me understand when should I be scaling into or out of different products either for profits or losses the other two things I want to talk about is pl validation and waiting pl validation is essentially when we look at whatever we think our tolerable Max losses or what we think our probable Max profit is and to make sure it makes sense against the chart so for example if we look at the vix and let's say that the max loss for a position I have on right now at 12 down here let's say the max loss would be 100 1,000 if I look at that and I say well there's a pretty fair probability that we hit 12 to the downside but I'm super not comfortable with that loss that tells me that there's a discrepancy with my pl based off of the probabilistic outcomes of the chart you have to you have to rectify those and the last thing is waiting depending on what you're trading it makes a lot of sense to wait different indicators differently and I talked about this in the first video but if you are trading intraday Zer DTE stuff the one-ear chart doesn't matter to you however if you're trading one year stuff the zero DTE chart doesn't matter to you so you have to figure out what it is that you're actually trying to trade and then use the
